criteria.description: Board parser validates legal moves, enforces turn order, and rejects occupied squares with clear errors.
criteria.justification: Move validation checks bounds and occupancy, but turn order isn't enforced (agent plays both sides) and move-format errors raise exceptions rather than clear feedback.

criteria.description: Reward structure differentiates wins (+1), draws (e.g., +0.1 or 0), losses (-1), and illegal moves (-1) with documented rationale.
criteria.justification: Rewards distinguish win/draw/illegal and encode losses as -1 when 'O' wins, but the agent controls both players and rationale is not documented.

criteria.description: Game state transitions correctly update board, toggle turns, and detect terminal conditions (win/draw) before issuing reward.
criteria.justification: Board updates, turn toggling, and terminal detection occur in correct order before reward assignment.

criteria.description: Game adversary is some what complex, and not just random moves, or not implemented at all.
criteria.justification: No adversary is implemented; the model takes every move for both symbols.

criteria.description: Rollout properly implements a multiturn rollout, and not just a single turn rollout.
criteria.justification: Loop continues making moves until terminal state (win/draw/illegal), constituting a multi-turn rollout.

notes: Parsing of user moves lacks robust validation and can crash on malformed inputs. There is no opponent logic; consider adding at least a heuristic or minimax opponent and clearly defining which symbol the agent controls. Document reward choices and include explicit error messaging for illegal or malformed moves.
